intro: Ageratina deltoidea, commonly known as delta ageratum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, fluffy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and a branching stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and they bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Ageratina deltoidea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and use in floral arrangements.
